moduleMetadataJson.name: Veritas Backup Exec Windows Remote File Access
moduleMetadataJson.description:
This module abuses a logic flaw in the Backup Exec Windows Agent to download
        arbitrary files from the system. This flaw was found by someone who wishes to
        remain anonymous and affects all known versions of the Backup Exec Windows Agent. The
        output file is in 'MTF' format, which can be extracted by the 'NTKBUp' program
        listed in the references section. To transfer an entire directory, specify a
        path that includes a trailing backslash.
author: hdm <x@hdm.io>
Unknown

options.name: WORKSPACE
options.description: Specify the workspace for this module

options.name: RHOSTS
options.description: The target host(s), range CIDR identifier, or hosts file with syntax 'file:<path>'

options.name: SSLVersion
options.description: Specify the version of SSL/TLS to be used (Auto, TLS and SSL23 are auto-negotiate) (Accepted: Auto, TLS, SSL23, SSL3, TLS1, TLS1.1, TLS1.2)

options.name: SSLVerifyMode
options.description: SSL verification method (Accepted: CLIENT_ONCE, FAIL_IF_NO_PEER_CERT, NONE, PEER)

options.name: Proxies
options.description: A proxy chain of format type:host:port[,type:host:port][...]

options.name: ConnectTimeout
options.description: Maximum number of seconds to establish a TCP connection

options.name: TCP::send_delay
options.description: Delays inserted before every send.  (0 = disable)

options.name: LHOST
options.description: The local IP address to accept the data connection

options.name: LPORT
options.description: The local port to accept the data connection

options.name: RPATH
options.description: The remote filesystem path to download

options.name: LPATH
options.description: The local filename to store the exported data
